Chapter.Label: HomAction
Chapter.Heading: The homology of origamis and the action of the Veech group on it.
Chapter.Emph: Important premise: We assume in this section, that origamis have no nontrivial translations (or equivalently the corresponding torus cover has no deck transformations).
Chapter.Section:
Bases of the fundamental group
This section contains functions, which compute a basis of the homology H = H_1( \mathcal{O}, \mathbb{Z}) of an origami \mathcal{O} and the action of an affine transformation f of \mathcal{O} on H . The later is the map f_\ast\colon H \to H . We consider the cellular homology with the squares of the Origami as 2-cell. We call \sigma_i the bottom edge of the square Q_1 and \xi_i the left edge of the square Q_i . Then we can represent an element of H as a formal linear combination of the \sigma 's and the \xi 's . In &GAP; we represent elements of H as elements of \mathbb{Z}^{2d} in the following way \sigma_i is represented by e_i and \xi_i is represented by e_{i + d} , where e_i is the i-th. standard basis vector of \mathbb{Z}^{2d} (And formal sums of elements in H are represented by the appropriate sums i \mathcal{Z}^{2d}).
Furthermore the action of the affine group respects the decompoition of the subspace H^{NT} of H of dimension 2g-2 and its orthogonal complement w.r.t the intersection form. We call this subspace of dimension 2g-2 the nontautological part of the homology. We are mostly interested in the restriction of the action to H^{NT} .

This function computes the image of the action of the Veech group on the nontautological part of the homology of O . If A is in the Veech group of O and f is an affine transformation with derivative A then {f_\ast}_{|H^{NT}} \colon {H^{NT} \to {H^{NT} is in the Shadow Veech group of O , encoded as matrix. The basis of the homology is computed with and the basis of the nontautological part is computed with .
